titleStmt.title: Paradice opened, or, The secreets, mysteries, and rarities of divine love, of infinite wisdom, and of wonderful counsel laid open to publick view also, the covenant of grace, and the high and glorious transactions of the Father and the Son in the covenant of redemption opened and improved at large, with the resolution of divers important questions and cases concerning both covenants ... : being the second and last part of The golden key / by Thomas Brooks ...
Golden key to open hidden treasures. Part 2
titleStmt.author: Brooks, Thomas, 1608-1680.

titleStmt.title: Paradice opened, or, The secreets, mysteries, and rarities of divine love, of infinite wisdom, and of wonderful counsel laid open to publick view also, the covenant of grace, and the high and glorious transactions of the Father and the Son in the covenant of redemption opened and improved at large, with the resolution of divers important questions and cases concerning both covenants ... : being the second and last part of The golden key / by Thomas Brooks ...
Golden key to open hidden treasures. Part 2
titleStmt.author: Brooks, Thomas, 1608-1680.

notesStmt.note: In this copy 24 preliminary leaves containing prefatory matter to "A word in season," another of Brooks' works, are bound after t.p. for this work (Paradice opened).
Also issued the same year as: The golden key, the second and last part, with a 2nd t.p. with title: Paradice opened, being the second and last part of The golden key.
Reproduction of original in Union Theological Seminary Library, New York.
